content: the brianna fingerless gloves are perfect for the colder weather the mittens are easy to make with advanced beginner knitters in mind using knit and purl stitches you will create stockinette stitched gloves with a thumb gusset this pair of mittens will be super cozy to wear in the cold weather yarn 1 x 100g skein of any medium weight yarn 04 / aran / worsted / 10 ply i used himalaya every day new tweed in olive green 75122 yarn substitute - cascade 220 in forest green 8267 needles 5mm us 8 9″ circular knitting needles or 16″ using the magic loop technique skills level intermediate this is an intermediate-level knitting pattern and the techniques involved are the knit stitch purl stitch increasing decreasing and knitting in the round sizing measurements length from wrist to top of hand 12 5 inches width laying flat 4 inches thumb 2 inches don t forget to follow handy little me on social media for more updates and to share your finished projects instagram @handylittleme facebook facebook com/handylittleme ravelry ravelry com/people/handylittleme pinterest pinterest co uk/handylittleme copyright the pattern and photographs of this design are the property of handy little me this pattern and design are subject to copyright and are for personal non-commercial use only you may not distribute or sell this pattern or any items created using the directions in this pattern without consent 1 https //www handylittleme com/outlander-fingerless-gloves-pattern/ 2 https //www handylittleme com/product/outlander-fingerless-gloves-knitting-pattern-pdf/ 3 https //www handylittleme com/product/outlander-knitting-patterns/
